chapter.title: Periodicals and Articles in Periodicals
chapter.para: It is not very often that one wishes to catalogue a whole periodical, but - again - for reasons of completeness it is included here We shall also see in the discussion of the detailed tabs why it is a good idea to separately catalogue periodicals
. A periodical has a title, one or more (often corporate) editors, and the periodical as a whole has a place and time of publication and an extent in number of volumes and issues published hitherto.
Actually, periodicals tend to be more complicated, since they often move around and change editors, but this is beyond the scope of the Basic Input Forms.

Perhaps the most common form of publication is the article. It has one or more authors, a title, and then a location inside a periodical. Here, one usually notes the title of the periodical as well as the location of the article inside the periodical, not the periodical editors or the place and time of publication of the periodical as such. Because of the (more or less) regular publication pattern of the periodical, one notes the time of publication of the article as part of its location.
